fileManagerAPI

Class LazyReader<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fileManagerAPI.LazyReader<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - generic type of data that the method manipulateFile must return.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileManager<E,java.io.BufferedReader>

    public abstract class LazyReader<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileManager<E,java.io.BufferedReader>
    This class implements an extremely lazy reader object. It would not do nothing except of writing stupid thinks. The generic data type T defined in FileManager is here set to be a BufferedReader object. This class leave unimplemented the abstract method manipulateFile().
    Author:
    Buoncompagni Luca
    See Also:
    FileManager

      • manipulateFile

        public abstract E manipulateFile()
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Do something on the file. This method need to open, manipulate and close the file. It also has to consider possible input/output Exception that this may cause.
        Specified by:
        manipulateFile in interface FileManager<E,java.io.BufferedReader>
        Returns:
        a generic type of data to notify that all operations has been correctly performed. Or it may return a data generated by the manipulations.

      • closeFile

        public void closeFile()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        This method is used to close all the connection with the file. Possible changes on the file may be available in the file only when the file has been closed.
        Specified by:

        public void openFile()
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        This method opens a connection with a file. It is not possible to operate on it before to call this procedure.
